wikipedia_page.main: Paul Barry Jackson (born 9 December 1959) is an Irish former cricketer. A right-handed batsman and wicket-keeper, he played 87 matches for the Ireland cricket team between 1981 and 1994 including eleven first-class matches against Scotland and eleven List A matches.

Millar was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland.Brian Millar – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2016. He made his debut for Ireland in August 1992, in a single-innings game against Gloucestershire.Miscellaneous matches played by Brian Millar – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2016. At the 1994 ICC Trophy in Kenya, Millar appeared in two of his team's seven matches (against Malaysia and the Netherlands), alternating with Paul Jackson as wicket-keeper.ICC Trophy matches played by Brian Millar – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2016. He made his first-class debut later in the year, against Scotland,First-class matches played by Brian Millar – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2016. and also represented Ireland in the 1994 NatWest Trophy (an English domestic one-day competition). Millar's final games for Ireland came in the 1995 Benson & Hedges Cup.List A matches played by Brian Millar – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2016.
